DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the evaluation of response status for vascular thrombosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The formation of a blood clot in the lumen of a vessel; causes include coagulation disorders, and vascular endothelial injury._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The formation of a blood clot in the lumen of a vessel; causes include coagulation disorders, and vascular endothelial injury.

Concepts.definition: The formation of a blood clot in the lumen of a vessel; causes include coagulation disorders, and vascular endothelial injury.

Property.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of a) no change or small changes that do not meet the criteria for irPR or irPD, taking as reference the smallest sum diameters while on study, b) increase in the volume of non-enhancing thrombosis, c) new bland non-enhancing thrombosis.

Concepts.definition: Any of a) no change or small changes that do not meet the criteria for irPR or irPD, taking as reference the smallest sum diameters while on study, b) increase in the volume of non-enhancing thrombosis, c) new bland non-enhancing thrombosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any unequivocal, unambiguous increase in the volume of new or existing enhancing thrombosis. Unequivocal progression of thrombosis corresponds to at least 73% increase in volume, which is similar to 20% increase in diameter, and at least a 5 mm absolute increase.

Concepts.definition: Any unequivocal, unambiguous increase in the volume of new or existing enhancing thrombosis. Unequivocal progression of thrombosis corresponds to at least 73% increase in volume, which is similar to 20% increase in diameter, and at least a 5 mm absolute increase.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of a) partial recanalization of thrombosis (if prior complete blockage), b) unequivocal reduction in the maximal girth of thrombosis, c) unequivocal reduction in the volume, or elimination, of arterial enhancing portion of thrombosis.

Concepts.definition: Any of a) partial recanalization of thrombosis (if prior complete blockage), b) unequivocal reduction in the maximal girth of thrombosis, c) unequivocal reduction in the volume, or elimination, of arterial enhancing portion of thrombosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complete resolution of thrombosis, with recanalization of vessel.

Concepts.definition: Complete resolution of thrombosis, with recanalization of vessel.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

DataElement.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON
